LanguageData.ChoppedStump_Polux.label: chopped polux stump
LanguageData.ChoppedStump_Polux.description: A stump left behind after a polux tree has been felled. The stump can be extracted but yields very little usable wood. Left outdoors, the stump will deteriorate in time.
LanguageData.Plant_TreePolux.label: polux tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreePolux.description: After generations of exposure, these trees have evolved to metabolize pollutants. By drawing pollutants from the ground through wide root networks, they slowly clean polluted terrain in their vicinity. However, they cannot do this if buildings are constructed over their roots.\n\nUnlike most methods of cleaning polluted terrain, polux trees do not create toxic wastepacks.
LanguageData.PoluxSeed.label: polux seed
LanguageData.PoluxSeed.description: The seed of a polux tree. It can be planted to create a new polux tree which will absorb pollution from nearby terrain.
LanguageData.SmashedStump_Polux.label: smashed polux stump
LanguageData.SmashedStump_Polux.description: The remnants of a polux tree destroyed by damage. It's ugly. The stump can be extracted but yields very little usable wood. Left outdoors, the stump will deteriorate in time.
